intro: Carallia mindanaensis, commonly known as Mindanao hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas within its native habitat.
